Eric Draven.Action: Rises from grave in pale burial suit, no shoes, in rain and mud, showing vulnerability.
Rises from the grave in a magical and controlled manner despite adverse conditions, indicating a confident return.
Appears pale, barefoot, and in a tattered burial suit, suggesting vulnerability and lack of physical readiness.
Wipes mud from his eyes, tries to clear vision and focuses on the crow that seems to guide him
Initially disoriented and doubtful when following the crow, hesitates before taking action
Lurches after the crow despite uncertainty, showing decisiveness in following the lead
Catches the injured woman as she falls into the alley darkness.
Shows pain when remembering the woman's assault through flashes.
Catches the wounded woman as she falls, immediately experiencing intense flashbacks connected to the crime scene, indicating quick awareness and connection to events.
Horrified as the woman he cares about is hurt and lets her drop away, blood on his hands.
Staggers back into alley cover, clearly shaken and affected by the woman's suffering.
Lurching flight, panting, showing physical and emotional exhaustion after traumatic event.
Horrified, lets the woman fade and drop away, staggers back into cover, blood on his hands.
Uses the crow's perspective ('Crowvision') to observe surroundings and gain information.
Looks up at the crow, disoriented and confused, not understanding what is happening.
Looks up at the crow, seemingly seeking silent communication.
Hauls himself upright despite wounds, showing resilience and self-reliance.
Puts on discarded combat boots found in the trash, practical and focused on survival rather than appearance.
Assesses his own wounds by feeling the bullet holes in his chest and back, reacts with dark humor.
Covers his eyes just in time to shield from an explosion, recoils and falls but recovers quickly.
Puts on discarded combat boots found in the trash to protect his bare, muddy feet.
Looks at the crow with an almost accusatory glance, indicating an attempt to understand or communicate silently.
No direct action or involvement in the excerpt; no demonstration of skill or confidence
Speaks to the crow with a steadier, friendly tone saying 'Thanks for sharing that.'
Climbs fire escape despite injuring his hand, showing determination but little indication of warmth.
Stares at the crow, feeling mocked, then shrugs and continues running despite stumbling and falling.
Stares at the crow, then runs but stumbles and falls, quickly recovering with a tumbling roll to land back on his feet and continue moving.
Looks back as if to ask 'Did I do that?' after a difficult tumble, showing a moment of vulnerability and humility.
Thanks the crow after it inspects him post-fall, indicating appreciation and politeness.
Successfully performs athletic rooftop jumps, shows physical agility and focus on the crow.
Manages to grab a phone cable bracket one-handed after a fall and executes a pull-up to save himself.
Bracket rips from the wall during pull-up resulting in a long fall.
Survives a high fall by rolling expertly on impact, showing physical skill and resilience.
Expresses frustration and surprise at still being alive after fall, indicating some self-awareness and reflection.
Lands silently and swiftly on the rooftop, moving like a feline, showing physical agility and control.
Follows the crow’s lead into an abandoned stairwell and approaches a crime scene cautiously, demonstrating situational awareness and patience.
Pauses and touches a cigarette burn on the banister, indicating attention to detail and emotional connection to the scene.
Expresses frustration by asking 'Are we finished yet?' showing some impatience but also self-awareness.
Remembers and confidently completes Albrecht's line with his full name, showing awareness and control despite physical pain from the flash.
Kneels and extends his hand to a stray cat, allowing it to approach and make contact.
Visibly emotional and distraught, whispering 'Stop it' in response to painful memories, showing vulnerability and remorse.
Punches his fist through a masonry wall in frustration and pain.
Shoves open a locked door, enters a damaged loft cautiously, scans surroundings and interacts gently with a cat.
Experiences intense emotional flashbacks that disrupt focus, punches through a masonry wall impulsively, and slumps weakly against the door frame.
Pushes himself up despite weakness and remains alert to surroundings (e.g., noticing the chalk outline and blood stain).
Abandons the safety of the chalk outline and staggers to the window, potentially exposing himself.
Shows physical resilience by rising from the floor despite severe injuries.
Catches Funboy's first slug high in the chest.
Cuts open his hand on jagged glass.
Reels backward and blacks out after being shot five times and thrown through a window.
Eyes pop open and rises from the floor after being unconscious and severely wounded.
Responds softly to mention of Shelly, expressing that he misses her.
Shows frustration and pain but does not lash out aggressively at the Skull Cowboy.
Uses violent means (tries to grab a knife to attack)
Picks up a stray cat cautiously, speaks to it gently, shows concern for its needs (cat food).
Performs a daring physical feat alone and silently, shows resilience but no interaction with others during it.
Interrupts a murder in progress, confronts criminal with calm surprise voice.
Confronts Tin-Tin calmly, repeating accusations to make him admit guilt.
Demonstrates restraint by slapping away knives instead of retaliating lethally immediately.
Blocks Tin-Tin's attacks and physically asserts control without immediately resorting to extreme violence.
Peels off his mask and asks Tin-Tin to tell a story, implying a desire to hear truth rather than silently kill.
Slaps away an incoming knife inches from his nose, shows calm and precise reflexes under threat.
Claps hands together to immobilize a thrown knife, demonstrating skillful disarming technique in combat.
Blocks a roundhouse kick and counters by smashing opponent into the wall, effectively controlling the fight.
Approaches Tin-Tin confidently and relentlessly despite thrown weapons, showing assertiveness and tactical control.
Peels off the mask while face-to-face with the enemy, choosing to engage in psychological confrontation after physical dominance.
Looks at the lipstick Shelly liked, softly recalls 'She always red red was her color'
Wears warpaint like a mask, talks bitterly to the Skull Cowboy, dismissive of the spiritual messenger
Applies white pancake makeup shakily, smears streaks until uniformly white, preparing himself with warpaint for what is ahead.
Drops lipstick on the floor in a moment of weakness or pain, initially wincing.
Acknowledges the Skull Cowboy's message about working for the dead but expresses annoyance and distraction, showing some resistance or difficulty accepting role.
Reaches deliberately to pick up lipstick after dropping it, signaling a conscious effort to regain composure and focus.
Prepares himself silently and deliberately for confronting 'bad guys', presenting a fierce, intimidating persona.
Carefully applies makeup to create a symbolic crow harlequin smile, demonstrating attention to detail and deliberate preparation.
Armed with Tin-Tin's knife slotted on his belt, indicating readiness and resourcefulness.
Moves with purpose and confidence, depicted stalking around, shadowed and cloaked, showing deliberate planning and self-assurance.
Swan dives boldly from a window into the night with a battle cry, illustrating courage but potentially risky action.
Breaks into the building by force, injures Gideon by throwing him and slamming a cage door on his head, takes a knife from him.
Speaks in a theatrical manner quoting Edgar Allan Poe, mocks Gideon lightly.
Explains calmly he is searching for something important (a gold engagement ring).
Interrogates Gideon aggressively and uses violence to immobilize him while searching for a ring.
Interrogates Gideon effectively, uses physical control and keen observation to find the ring, and efficiently incapacitates Gideon with a shotgun butt.
Takes time inspecting multiple rings showing patience and attention to detail before identifying the correct one.
Uses violence decisively and strategically to maintain control over the situation without hesitation.
Rams a shotgun into Gideon's nose, smashes cans near him, intimidates him.
Ignores Gideon's pleas and threats, focuses on his mission without engaging further.
Pauses to admire a guitar among pawnables, showing a moment of appreciation unrelated to violence.
Disarms and incapacitates Gideon efficiently, intimidates him to extract important information with calculated threats.
Smashes and punctures cans to intimidate Gideon, showing controlled aggression to dominate the situation.
Pauses momentarily to admire and take the guitar while keeping his weapon ready and maintaining control.
Ignores Gideon after getting the information, choosing not to waste time on further confrontation.
Moves slowly with palms up in a gesture of submission towards a gun-wielding police officer.
Bows, bringing his forehead in line with the gun's muzzle, inviting the officer to shoot if he will.
Calmly informs Albrecht about the injured man needing help, referencing Shelly Webster's past need for his assistance and implying his own forthcoming help.
Saves Albrecht from potential violence by showing he means no harm through a dramatic, non-violent gesture (drawing blood, marking the wall, then healing).
Engages with Albrecht using street knowledge and familiar tone, maintaining communication despite tension.
Smiles warmly at Elly, showing friendliness beyond his crow makeup.
Smiles warmly and responds calmly to a child's mockery despite his crow makeup, showing emotional control and confidence in social interaction.
Glances back and logs the location of the Pit for later, not in a big hurry but aware; calmly takes a seat next to Elly to observe.
Responds calmly and with subtle humor to Elly's suspicion; shows social confidence in interaction.
Engages in gentle, patient conversation with Elly, answering her questions and showing interest in playing music for a child.
Experiences a painful flash yet responds with momentary disconnection rather than anger or frustration; allows Elly to retrieve the doll without complaint.
Walks away determined after brief exchange, showing focus on his goal rather than engaging more with Elly.
Asks relevant questions about Mister Funboy and the doll, showing awareness and attention to detail.
Experiences an intense emotional flash and pain that almost overwhelms him, causing a momentary lapse.
Despite being half-zomboid and struggling with pain, he shows determination and decides to leave and take action.
Calmly lurks in shadows with crow perched on shoulder, showing patience and readiness without aggression.
Recites poetic lines while stalking, indicating a reflective, possibly sensitive nature.
Approaches Funboy and Darla during their drug use calmly, does not engage in violence immediately, shows control under threat.
Reveals his bullet wounds to intimidate Funboy, challenging Funboy to shoot him.
Does not harm Funboy or Darla despite their hostility and fear; disarms the situation without violence.
Surprises Funboy and Darla by appearing calmly at their location, showing no panic and confidently confronting Funboy despite his drugged state and the presence of a gun.
Displays his bullet wounds to intimidate Funboy, demonstrating awareness of his invulnerability and using it strategically to maintain control of the situation.
Invites Funboy to shoot him, revealing a bold, fearless stance that shows confidence, though potentially risking unnecessary provocation.
Appears to defuse a highly dangerous situation without immediate violence, indicating self-control and situational understanding.
Stops Darla from escaping and forcibly removes morphine from her arm to save her from addiction.
Responds to being shot with dry humor rather than anger.
Shows no immediate aggression or retaliation despite being attacked; tries to maintain composure.
Offers Funboy painkiller after subduing him despite their hostile confrontation.
Rams a lethal dose of morphine into Funboy’s heart, effectively killing him.
In a moment of extreme physical weakness and surprise, quickly disarms Funboy by twisting his wrist causing Funboy to shoot himself in the thigh.
Calmly inspects the morphine and uses the syringe effectively to end Funboy's pain, showing knowledge and decisiveness.
Falls back on the bed, his force spent, indicating a moment of physical limitation and exhaustion.
Informs Darla about her missing daughter and urges her to go find her immediately despite the tense situation.
Dismissively tells the Skull Cowboy to 'Go away' and 'Shut up,' showing impatience and irritability.
Rams the needle into Funboy's heart, delivering a full dose despite physical strain.
Firmly instructs Darla to leave and save her daughter, showing clear, decisive communication under pressure.
Responds to the Skull Cowboy's admonishments with terse, dismissive replies, indicating possible impatience or lack of open-mindedness.
Recovers slowly and thoughtfully after confrontation, stoops to lift the guitar, showing awareness and focus despite exhaustion.
Winks at Grange and shushes him instead of engaging in violence; jumps out into the night without harm.
Sneaks up on Albrecht silently and commands him to freeze, startling him badly.
Enters Funboy's room silently and surprises Grange by appearing on the window sill, evading capture with a confident wink and quiet exit.
Approaches Albrecht silently and commands him to 'freeze', startling Albrecht and maintaining control of the interaction.
Hesitates to touch the file about himself; asks Albrecht to walk with him and share what he remembers about their deaths.
Touches Albrecht's temples gently, holding thumbs over his eyes to 'shield' him from painful memories.
Reacts with horror and anguish when confronted with traumatic memories of his girlfriend's death.
Asks Albrecht to walk and talk, seeking out information about what happened to him and his girlfriend, showing initiative and intent to understand his situation.
Hesitates to touch the file containing information about himself, indicating emotional conflict or uncertainty.
Proactively presses Albrecht to recall details of the events, demonstrating persistence and a methodical approach to uncovering the truth.
Physically overwhelms Albrecht by holding his temples and covering his eyes to induce a flashback, showing an unconventional but purposeful investigative method.
Reacts with horror and staggers away holding his head, showing vulnerability to traumatic memories, which may temporarily reduce his effectiveness.
Lowers his head, penitent when confronted by Albrecht.
Thanks Albrecht for caring and giving a damn.
Warns Albrecht not to smoke cigarettes despite taking one to think.
Disappears suddenly and silently, leaving Albrecht unable to find him.
Uses violence and intimidation to control T-Bird, forcing him to comply and driving recklessly.
Silently disarms T-Bird by throwing a knife into his ear and then seizes his automatic weapon, controlling him without losing composure.
Commands T-Bird to drive and stop talking, demonstrating confident control of the situation.
Takes advantage of T-Bird's driving skills while maintaining the upper hand by holding a gun on him.
Levels gun at T-Bird's face to silence him and force him to drive faster.
Makes a distracted, ironic eyebrow raise to T-Bird after tossing a giant dildo out the window.
Holds T-Bird's gun on him confidently and commands him to drive somewhere unfamiliar at high speed.
Calmly cocks the pistol and uses it to silence T-Bird's complaints, maintaining control of the situation.
Rifles the glove box and discards items to lighten load and prepare for confrontation, showing strategic thinking.
Admits to T-Bird's popularity with a wry tone, showing a hint of ironic camaraderie.
Responds to T-Bird's antagonistic threat with calm and controlled payback rather than escalating aggression.
Uses previously established gaffer's tape immediately when needed during a high-speed chase, showing preparedness and focus.
Maintains stoic composure under extreme stress during pursuit and confrontation.
Confidently confronts T-Bird with clear intent for calculated revenge, demonstrating control of situation.
Prepares the trunk with explosives and timers, implying careful planning and tactical skill.
Effectively restrains T-Bird with a bungie cord and incendiary device, demonstrates awareness of the timer's delay, and uses the environment and available resources skillfully.
Calmly disarms T-Bird's pistol by removing the clip one bullet at a time while the car is moving toward the dock edge, showing composure and precision under pressure.
Does not hesitate or display confusion in the tense situation, maintains control of events confidently.
Plays guitar passionately, seemingly conjuring a memory of Shelly with sincerity.
Stops playing immediately when an irate voice shouts at him, showing sensitivity to others.
Plays the guitar with strong, sure chords that convey passion and skill.
Momentarily distracted by an irate voice while immersed in music, but quickly aware of his surroundings.
Embraces and recalls intimate memories with Shelly tenderly and lovingly, showing deep connection and affection.
Performs solitary preparation and training, focusing inwardly and enduring personal pain silently.
Performs complex and deliberate physical movements with focus and control, preparing mentally and physically for upcoming events.
Embraces the pain from memories with calm breathing and mental resilience.
Holds his hand in front of his face and flexes it, preparing himself physically and mentally for what is coming next.
Perches silently on the exterior ledge, preparing for confrontation without unnecessary words or threats.
Perched silently on a narrow exterior ledge, hidden and observing Top Dollar's lair undetected, demonstrating patience, stealth, and situational awareness.
Carefully collects and inspects shell casings (.45 caliber) from the scene, showing attention to detail and tactical consideration.
Intervenes in violent confrontation by disarming multiple enemies to protect others.
Engages in aggressive gunfire and violent conflict without apparent attempt at peaceful resolution.
Backflips the length of the table, kicks the gun from Skank's hand, catches it mid-air and gains control of the weapon.
Stands on the table, fires skillfully under his own arm to take out multiple opponents while being targeted himself.
Evades return fire effectively, disappears from the line of fire and shoots Skank who had risen elsewhere.
Intercepts and disarms Top Dollar at close range after Top Dollar runs out of ammo.
Confronts Top Dollar aggressively, physically slams him against the wall to make him understand Shelly's suffering.
Physically overpowers Top Dollar, demonstrates control and intimidation by holding him hypnotically, uses vivid flashbacks to unsettle and convey key information.
Expresses anger and pain but does not lose control in confrontation, showing mental resilience and focus.
Lets Top Dollar drop like a laundry sack after Top's terror-stricken failure.
Fights police aggressively and escapes rather than surrendering.
Uses quick thinking to shove a heavy table at incoming SWAT officers, then performs an acrobatic dive through a window under fire to evade capture.
Confidently confronts and physically overpowers an adversary (Top Dollar) before engaging in a high-risk escape.
Navigates a dangerous rooftop situation with awareness and agility, ducking bullets and moving skillfully.
Outruns and evades law enforcement with agility, avoiding direct confrontation or harm to others.

Runs, climbs up brickwork using tiny cracks, evades SWAT and helicopter spotlight by artful moves and parkour skills, and successfully escapes by jumping off the roof into the alley, landing safely and continuing to run.
Accepts a ride from Albrecht despite being seriously injured.
Takes Albrecht’s cigarette and pitches the smoke out the window, advising him not to smoke.
Backpedals and scans for alternate escape when trapped by police car, then dives into the car quickly to evade capture.
Calmly communicates with Albrecht about mission completion and remaining threats, showing clear situational awareness.
Minimizes his many wounds as 'only a flesh wound' and takes a cigarette puff then discards it, showing nonchalance under pressure.
Expresses doubt about his physical condition but insists he has finished his task, suggesting awareness but possible underestimation of his vulnerability.
Refuses medical help and the morgue, stating he has one more thing to do despite his clearly weakened state.
Refuses medical help despite serious injury, stating he has one more thing to do.
Fights to stay centered and conscious after sustaining great damage to prepare for a critical upcoming night.
Does not respond to Albrecht’s concerns about his wellbeing and potential for more violence, showing single-minded focus.
Burns personal mementos of his past deliberately to achieve emotional closure, speaks calmly and clearly about his feelings to Elly.
Appears emotionally tapped, exhausted, and physically slowed, movements retarded and slack.
Draws Elly close and wipes away her tear, offers comforting words about mourning and remembering loved ones.
Gives Elly the cat Gabriel, shows generosity and kindness.
Gives Elly Shelly's ring so she can remember her fondly and feel she is still alive.
Plays the guitar loudly with boldness and heartbreak, showing strength and a sense of homecoming.
Smashes his guitar in a moment of climax and emotional release.
Plays guitar loudly and confidently, transforming uncertain pain into bold, heartbreaking strength; symbolically smashing the guitar at the climax, signaling a purposeful end and emotional control.
Smiles at a kid in costume who asks for a trick or treat, but says 'Not tonight.'
Brutally crisscrosses arms with black vinyl tape, dons night-fighting clothes, smears makeup on face preparing for confrontation.
Defiantly insists on continuing his mission alone despite warnings of danger and loneliness.
Defiantly confronts the Skull Cowboy, accepting danger and vulnerability with resolve.
Ignores warnings about loss of powers and no reunion, choosing to proceed anyway.
Advances despite the Skull Cowboy physically blocking the way, showing confidence and determination.
Talks to dead air and seems almost to argue with it, which might suggest some erratic internal behavior.
Stares down the Skull Cowboy with steely resolve, not wasting time.
Lunges instinctively toward the remaining Skull Cowboy's form, showing concern or attachment.
Expresses astonishment and asks the Crow why it is still present, showing openness and sincerity.
Marches forward cautiously into the church despite leery feelings, indicating determination but neutral on warmth.
Eyes steely, stares down the Skull Cowboy and decisively rejects wasting time.
Lunges toward the Skull Cowboy's remnants, showing urgency but meets only vaporous dust.
Registers the dust in his hand and processes the disappearance calmly before noticing the crow.
Is astonished by the crow landing on his shoulder but accepts the silence and proceeds forward.
Marches confidently to the church doors and pushes them open despite an eerie, potentially threatening environment.
Approaches the altar leery of dangers but cautiously investigates, indicating awareness and care.
Spins and hisses venomously to protect the crow from a dart, showing care and protectiveness for the crow.
Does not directly engage in dialogue or violent retaliation against Lao immediately, maintaining composure despite danger to Elly and himself.
Sustains injury (knees buckle) when protecting the crow, indicating willingness to endure pain to protect others.
Leery of potential danger as he approaches the altar, showing awareness and caution.
Clearly sees and acknowledges Elly on the TV screen, demonstrating focus and situational awareness.
Ducks incoming dart after hearing the shot, showing quick reflexes but is still struck and loses some strength temporarily.
Insists on the girl remaining unharmed despite his own injured state.
Actively fights guards in a violent confrontation, using lethal force.
Rejects Albrecht's offers of help, insists Albrecht leave and not interfere.
Defeats a guard decisively, removing their weapon and saluting an ally confidently.
Firmly rejects Albrecht's help, clearly setting boundaries and maintaining control over the situation.
Tests the bellrope before climbing, showing caution and preparation.
Climbs the bellrope quickly and skillfully despite bleeding and injury.
Breaks the guard's sword and drops the pieces before turning his back, potentially risking exposure to pursuit.
Attempts to rescue Elly by wrestling the lightning rod free despite the pain from its heat.
Engages in a physical fight with Lao without weapon, showing determination to protect others.
Vaults down the roof using the lightning rod to save Elly from slipping off the roof, supports her hanging on to him.
Displays rage and anger after the death of Albrecht, glares at Lao.
Uses the lightning rod skillfully to vault down the roof and save Elly from falling.
Loses sight of Lao who then kills Albrecht while Eric is too far away to intervene.
Maintains focus and rage after Albrecht's death, preparing to confront Lao again.
Arrests Lao's fall, holding him tightly despite fury.
Eyes alight with hatred for Lao, internalizes intense hatred.
Fights Lao aggressively after being stabbed, shows resilience but with grim determination.
Holds Lao tightly during a backward roll to protect him from a blade.
Slows down to allow Elly to reach him and they grasp hands tightly.
Despite being wounded and in pain, he tries to give Elly hope by offering Shelly's ring and letting her know she can come to him.
Clutches his own chest and looks glazed despite the pain, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Grasps Elly's face tenderly and kisses her forehead despite his own grievous injuries.
Tells Elly to leave him and lets go when he can't continue, showing acceptance and concern for her well-being.
Despite grievous injuries, he shows determination by holding the rose and trying to reach his grave, displaying emotional strength and resolve.
Collapses before reaching his grave and tells Elly to leave him, showing acceptance of his physical limitations without panicking, indicating self-awareness and control.
Relies on Shelly's hand to assist him moving forward, indicating willingness to accept help and an ability to adapt to his near-death state.
